result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquise Z Mayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  No controlled substances or alcohol.   Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquise Z Mayes

Matter here for Sentencing.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Defense made a request to remove the GPS for job search.  The State objects to it being completely removed, but will not object it to being modified.  Sworn:  Damone Turner.  The Court allows Defendant to be release for work, up to 40 hours a week, with Damone Turner and Damone Turner will provide the specific hours for Defendant to work to Justice Point.  The Defendant can only be released to go to and from work. 

Matter is adjourned to December 3, 2015 at 8:30am for sentencing in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Marquise Z Mayes in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Paul M. Hauer for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a return on warrant.  Warrant was issued on today's date in the am.  Defendant voluntairly came into court with his attorney in the pm.  The Court admonished the Defendant for his Justice Point Violation.  Defendant's grandfather, Jimmy Williams, informed the Court that the defendant was home during the time the Justice Point violation said his monitoring device was not charged.  The Court VACATED the warrant and released the defendant with the same conditions.

Matter is set for sentencing on October 8, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Branch 26 received this case as a result of a substitution against Judge Conen Branch 30.  A substitution has already been filed on July 2, 2014 against Judge Siefert Branch 47.  This case is being referred back to Judge Conen Branch 30.

Per substitution filed against Judge Conen.
against Judge Conen filed by Atty. Thomas Harris on behalf of the defendant.  The newly assigned court is Judge Pocan's Court.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement; filed.

Defendant Marquise Z Mayes in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 2 (MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Case adjourned to 09-01-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

  Parties advised that effective August 1, 2015, this case is assigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30, in Room 635 of the Courthouse.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Court MODIFIED the conditions of release as follows:  If defendant provides to Justice Point verification that he has a job interview appointment, Court will allow defendant to attend the job interview.  If defendant provides to Justice Point verification that he is enrolled in school, Court will allow defendant to attend school and orientation for school.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Matter in court for status of counsel and Bail/Bond Hearing.

Atty. Thomas Harris is now the attorney of record.

Court addressed defendant's conditions of bail release:  Defendant requests modification of the 24-hour curfew to allow him to seek employment and attend school.  State objects.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS defendant's requests.  Court MODIFIED the conditions of release as follows:  If defendant provides to Justice Point verification that he has a job interview appointment, Court will allow defendant to attend the job interview.  If defendant provides to Justice Point verification that he is enrolled in school, Court will allow defendant to attend school and orientation for school.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.
